required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: STereotactic RadioAblation by Multimodal Imaging for VT (STRA-MI-VT)
clinical_study.official_title: STereotactic RadioAblation by Multimodal Imaging for VT (STRA-MI-VT)

brief_summary.textblock: Study of multimodal-imaging guided stereotactic body radiotherapy (SBRT) for ventricular tachycardia (VT) ablation.

detailed_description.textblock:
STRA-MI-VT study is a spontaneous, open-label, not randomized, prospective clinical trial.
The objective of the study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of SBRT in strictly selected patients with refractory VT.
Multimodal cardiac imaging combined with electroanatomic mapping to provide a specific patient's tailored SBRT treatment plan choosing amang different linear accelerators.

primary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events will be defined using CTCAE v4.0 criteria.

primary_outcome.measure: SBRT efficacy based on reduction of VT episodes during 12 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: There will be 6 week blanking period after therapy to allow for ablation effect

secondary_outcome.description: Health related quality of life for positive or negative changes based on score from SF-36 Questionnaire
Cardiac functional changes evaluated by echocardiography ejection fraction

arm_group.description: Non-randomized, open label clinical trial that intends to treat with SBRT 15 patients with refractory VT.

intervention.description: Multimodal-imaging guided SBRT for VT ablation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ICD/S-ICD recipients with refractory VT
- Not eligible for conventional catheter ablation or -in alternative- that have undergone failing conventional catheter ablation attempts, refusing surgery for the treatment of the arrhythmia.
- LVEF ≥ 20%.
- Age ≥ 50 years.
- Signed an IRB approved written informed consent document.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous radiotherapy with cardiac involvement.
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding.
- Active myocardial ischemia.
- Acute revascularation in the past 120 days.
- Acute hemodynamic instability (cardiogenic shock/NYHA IV).
- Serious disease with presumed life expectancy less than 12 months.
- Any condition that is deemed a contraindication in the judgment of the investigators.

reference.citation: Carbucicchio C, Jereczek-Fossa BA, Andreini D, Catto V, Piperno G, Conte E, Cattani F, Rondi E, Vigorito S, Piccolo C, Bonomi A, Gorini A, Pepa M, Mushtaq S, Fassini G, Moltrasio M, Tundo F, Marvaso G, Veglia F, Orecchia R, Tremoli E, Tondo C. STRA-MI-VT (STereotactic RadioAblation by Multimodal Imaging for Ventricular Tachycardia): rationale and design of an Italian experimental prospective study. J Interv Card Electrophysiol. 2021 Sep;61(3):583-593. doi: 10.1007/s10840-020-00855-2. Epub 2020 Aug 27.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Ventricular Intensive Care Unit
